There are many great Black Friday game deals, including the biggest discount yet for the excellent Metaphor ReFantazio. The acclaimed RPG is down to just $50 on PS5 and Xbox Series X at Amazon, a nearly 30% price cut from its $70 list price.

Metaphor ReFantazio is a narrative-focused RPG featuring an intriguing tale that covers the race to crown a new king in a fantasy land of swords and sorcery. Fans of other Atlus RPGs like Persona and Shin Megami Tensei will recognize the game's focus on social interactions and strategic turn-based battles, but Metaphor's unique high fantasy setting, bold art direction, and epic musical score all represent bold new directions for the studio. The result is one of Atlus' best games, earning a rare 10/10 score here on GameSpot, with reviewer Jessica Cogswell noting that "Metaphor: ReFantazio combines Atlus' skill in crafting emotionally charged RPGs with brilliant plot twists, a keen sense of adventure, and fantastical idealism to create one of its greatest games yet."

More Atlus RPG Black Friday deals

Several other Atlus games are included in Amazon's Black Friday discount you're looking for even more meaty RPGs to get you through the long winter nights, including the latest entries in the Persona series. Persona 3 Reload launched earlier this year for $70, but it's on sale for $25 while Persona 5 Royal is available for as little as $20 (was $60).

Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance is also getting a Black Friday price cut to $25 (was $60). This is an enhanced version of the 2021 game featuring sharper visuals and several quality-of-life upgrades--so if you've ever wanted to experience a Pokemon-like adventure set in a wasteland inhabited by warring factions of angels and demons, this is a good time to do so.

item.title: Pick Up Dragon's Dogma 2 For Just $50 On PS5 And Xbox Series X During Amazon's Black Friday Sale

https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pick-up-dragons-dogma-2-for-just-50-on-ps5-and-xbox-series-x-during-amazons-black-friday-sale/1100-6527817/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

One of the most interesting RPGs 2024, Dragon's Dogma 2, is down to its lowest price yet during Amazon's Black Friday sale that just went live. You can pick up the open-world fantasy epic for just $40 on PS5 and Xbox Series X.

Dragon's Dogma 2 Black Friday Deal at Amazon

  • PS5 -- $50 ($70)
  • Xbox Series X -- $50 ($70)

Like its predecessor, Dragon's Dogma 2 is an open-world action RPG that harkens back to the challenge and friction of the genre's more hardcore roots. It's not necessarily for everyone, but anyone looking for a deep action RPG will find a lot to like about Dragon's Dogma 2--especially if you were a fan of the first game. GameSpot reviewer Richard Wakeling scored the game a 9/10, calling it "an enchanting open-world RPG with varied, exciting combat and a player-created companion system that's still unlike anything else. It doesn't do much beyond what the original did, but advancements in technology have enhanced its anomalous strengths, breathing new life into its massive open world and the ways in which you and everything around you can interact with it."

Several of the biggest games of 2024 are also on sale right now, if you’re looking to prepare yourself for a festive season gaming binge. There’s the blistering action of Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2, polished frights in the Silent Hill 2 remake, and the fantasy epic Metaphor ReFantazio to consider. Each one of these games normally retail for $70, but they’re currently available for $50 each as part of Amazon's Black Friday sale. Check out the full sale to see all the discounts, and keep tabs on GameSpot's deals coverage for more of the best Black Friday price cuts available.

item.title: Pick Up A Discounted Victrix Pro Fight Stick Just In Time For Your Holiday Gaming
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pick-up-a-discounted-victrix-pro-fight-stick-just-in-time-for-your-holiday-gaming/1100-6527849/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fighting games are bigger and better than ever, and if you're looking to make your next round of Street Fighter 6 or Tekken 8 a winning one, you might want to check out this Black Friday special on Victrix's Pro FS fight sticks, which are discounted to $320 (normally $400).

This deal includes both the traditional FS model that is equipped with a joystick on Sanwa JLF base and the FS-12 leverless version that replaces the joystick with extra inputs. While it feels somewhat alien to use at first, leverless fight sticks are becoming very popular with professional fighting game players as these can help pull off tricky moves in games more reliably. As for colors, there are two options here, depending on your tastes.

Both models have Sanwa Denshi 30mm buttons, a removable Sanwa Densi Ball-top joystick on the regular model, and a foam lap pad for comfortable gaming sessions. You can also open them up for when you want to do some customization or cleaning, and since they're made from a single piece of aircraft-grade aluminum, they can easily survive a turbulent trip to Las Vegas for the next Evo tournament. If you'd prefer something nondescript, you can pick up one of these fight sticks in a crisp PS5-style white, or for something flashier, there's a bright purple finish.

Victrix Pro FS fight stick (PS5/PS4/PC)

  • White -- $320 ($400)
  • Purple -- $320 ($400)

Victrix Pro FS-12 leverless fight stick (PS5/PS4/PC)

  • White -- $320 ($400)
  • Purple -- $320 ($400)

Alternatively, you can also check out the Razer Kitsune. This is a bit more affordable at $270 (was $300), and depending on your preferences, it might be superior to the Victrix Pro. This is Razer's take on the leverless style fighting game controller, and it features low-profile linear optical switches and a slick design that's complemented with RGB lighting.

For more deals, be sure to check out Amazon's full Black Friday sale. You can also check out GameSpot's Black Friday deals hub for all the latest discounts throughout the holiday shopping season.

item.title: Learn To Play Kirby Like An Instrument With These Black Friday Deals
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/learn-to-play-kirby-like-an-instrument-with-these-black-friday-deals/1100-6527865/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you’re trying to find a unique gift for the holiday season, look no further than this adorable Kirby Otamatone Synthesizer. The Otamatone is incredibly popular in Japan, and for Black Friday, you can now grab it at a discount. The deals include the Deluxe edition for $72 (was $90) and standard edition for $45 (was $59), plus a smaller keychain-sized variant for just $19 (was $25).

Kirby Otamatone Synthesizer

$72 (was $90)

The Otamatone is a unique synthesizer with a very distinct sound. It’s shaped like a musical note, and in this case, it’s painted to look like Kirby. You play the instrument by sliding your finger into different positions on its neck, while opening Kirby’s mouth will alter the sound. The instrument is also built with a 3.5mm jack, allowing you to connect it to headphones or speakers. It’s a quirky gadget--and it might take some time to master--but just about anyone should be able to pick it up and have fun with its charming sounds.

The Deluxe edition includes an exclusive Kirby Strap to help you find a comfortable playing position and an instruction manual to teach you the basics. The keychain edition isn’t quite as elaborate as the other two models, as you’ll just be pressing a button to the rhythm to make one of its many songs play. But at $19, it makes a great gift for kids who are interested in musical instruments, teaching them the basics of beat and rhythm. It also has a metal loop to attach it to a keychain or backpack.

Don’t expect to pick these up and start playing songs like an expert right away--even though it looks adorable, the Otamatone is a legitimate musical instrument. If you want some help, consider pairing your Otamatone with the book, How to Play the Otamatone for Beginners, which walks you through everything you need to know to start growing your skills.

Once you’re done checking out this great deal, dive into our Black Friday Hub for even more offers on video games, laptops, Lego sets, and other electronics.

item.title: Western Digital PS5 SSDs On Sale For Great Prices At Amazon For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/western-digital-ps5-ssds-on-sale-for-great-prices-at-amazon-for-black-friday/1100-6527921/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you're looking to upgrade your PS5's storage capacity during the holiday shopping season, there are already some great deals on PlayStation 5-compatible NVMe SSDs from the most popular brands, including Western Digital. The WD Black SN850X 1TB model is discounted to only $90 at Amazon ahead of Black Friday 2024.

You'll also find deals on 2TB and 4TB versions of the SN850X below. If you also own an Xbox Series X|S or are in need of a holiday gift for an Xbox fan, the WD Black C50 1TB Expansion Card is on sale for $100 (was $150) at Amazon, which is its lowest price yet.

WD Black SN850X SSD with Heatsink for PS5

1TB - $90 (was $130) | 4TB - $270 (was $380)

The WD Black SN850X can hit speeds of up to 7,300MB/s, significantly faster than the required 5,500MB/s sequential read speed for full support on PS5. The 1TB model that's on sale includes a preinstalled heatsink, which is needed for installation in the PS5's open M.2 slot.

At face value, a 1TB SSD sounds like doubling your PlayStation's storage space, but it's actually an even more meaningful increase. The original PS5 has roughly 667GB of usable storage, while the PS5 Slim has about 850GB.

If you want an even bigger upgrade, Amazon has the 2TB SN850X on sale for $130. The only downside with this deal is that it doesn't. come with a heatsink, so you will need to buy one separately and install it yourself. Thankfully, it only takes a few minutes, and heatsinks are cheap, including this $9 model.

Anything above 2TB is probably overdoing it for most PS5 users, but the SN850X is also one of the best SSDs for PC, a platform where storage gets consumed by more than just games. Amazon has the 4TB SN850X with a heatsink on sale for over $100 off.

  • WD Black 1TB SN850X with Heatsink -- $90 ($130)
  • WD Black 2TB SN850X -- $130 ($190)
  • WD Black 4TB SN850X with Heatsink -- $270 ($380)
  • Corsair MP600 Pro 1TB -- $80 ($110)

For a slightly cheaper 1TB option, check out Corsair's MP600 for $80. This one also comes with a heatsink, and while it's not as popular as the SN850X, it's still plenty fast enough for PS5 users, with speeds up to 7,100MB/s.
